function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inaccurate and unreliable ai forecasting models due to noisy and limited data"},{"name":"Search string focusing on contagious diseases could lead to biased results and miss important studies related to other diseases or areas of research."},{"name":"Exclusion of nonpeer-reviewed articles and studies in other languages with no english translation might lead to language and publication bias."},{"name":"Reliance on ai algorithms for quality assessment may overlook important nuances and context in the evaluation of research articles."},{"name":"High-risk patients identification"},{"name":"Covid-19 hotspot mapping"},{"name":"Inadequate real-time case surveillance"},{"name":"Shortage of covid-19 testing kits and detection tools"},{"name":"Quarantine-induced reduction in physical activity energy expenditure"},{"name":"Mental health impacts of lack of access to exercise and physical activity"},{"name":"Correlation between physical activity and psychological well-being"},{"name":"Worsening of psychophysical conditions due to pandemic-induced restrictions"},{"name":"Gender disparity in the correlation between physical activity reduction and psychological well-being"},{"name":"Increased physical activity energy expenditure during quarantine"},{"name":"Decreased physical activity levels during the pandemic"},{"name":"Low physical activity levels among italian adults, especially during covid-19 quarantine"},{"name":"Difficulty in performing intense exercise at home compared to moderate activity"},{"name":"Challenges of maintaining physical activity levels during quarantine"},{"name":"Worldwide spread of sars-cov-2 leading to containment measures and quarantine"},{"name":"Limited sample size for the study"},{"name":"Absence of national health monitoring and surveillance system for physical activity in italy"},{"name":"Reduction of physical activity linked with worse psychological well-being during covid-19."},{"name":"Gender differences in the correlation between physical activity and psychological well-being during covid-19."},{"name":"Decrease in physical activity levels during covid-19 pandemic."},{"name":"Increased housework activities leading to unexpected physical activity levels in certain population groups."},{"name":"Significant decrease in physical activity among different gender and age groups during quarantine."},{"name":"Percentage increase in low active individuals during covid-19 pandemic"},{"name":"Subjective perception of well-being during covid-19 emergency may reflect the psychological impact of the pandemic on the participants."},{"name":"Use of statistical analysis software may introduce errors in data interpretation and reporting."},{"name":"Possible transmission of covid-19 through the completion of an online questionnaire."},{"name":"Lack of privacy and data security for participants due to online questionnaire administration."},{"name":"Use of online survey may lead to low response rate due to survey fatigue and lack of interest."},{"name":"Potential breach of anonymity and confidentiality due to technology or human error."},{"name":"Physical activity may ameliorate pathological outcomes of upper respiratory tract infections urti , including covid-19, by reducing excessive local inflammation and inducing the secretion of anti-inflammatory cytokines."},{"name":"Physical activity can be effective in ameliorating mental well-being and preventing symptoms of mental health disorders such as depression and anxiety."},{"name":"Examination of changes in physical activity levels during self-quarantine may provide insight into the impact of restrictions on physical activity and its correlation with individual well-being."},{"name":"Undesirable effects of prolonged quarantine"},{"name":"Long-term detraining due to forced stop of physical activity"},{"name":"Global spread of covid-19 epidemic"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through droplet and close contact"},{"name":"Risk of contamination through bodily fluids and transmission through oral or conjunctival routes"},{"name":"Incomplete understanding of infectiousness changes over time"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of bio-sensors and smart sanitation technology in infrastructure and sanitation products."},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases through community wastewater"},{"name":"Reliance on wbe as the sole surveillance tool"},{"name":"Exposure to contaminated wastewater with pathogens"},{"name":"High demand for the health system and availability of intensive care"},{"name":"Inadequate control measures of social protection and economic package"},{"name":"Cross-boundary and cross-sectoral transmission of covid-19"},{"name":"Inadequate wastewater management and treatment"}]}
